main event: A British West Indies Airlines flight witnessed a meteor explode in the Caribbean Sea on June 25, 1960.
interesting points: The airline witnessed an explosion of a meteor and obtained samples described as lightweight and metallic., Two samples reported were sponge-like material and a lemon-shaped piece of very light metal., The bright white object spotted by the airline disintegrated into several green flaming objects., The sighting was reported at 0220 GMT., The document indicates a conclusion that the sighting was a meteor.
sighted object: a bright white object with a green center
